title: AST SpaceMobile licensed to connect test satellite to US cellular phones
summary: AST SpaceMobile secured an experimental license May 2 to test services in the United States from BlueWalker 3, the prototype satellite slated to launch this summer for its planned cellphone-compatible broadband constellation.

title: Rocket Lab briefly catches booster in mid-air after successful launch
summary: Rocket Lab used a helicopter to capture a spent Electron first stage booster and its parachute after launching satellites from New Zealand Monday, a significant step forward for the company’s rocket recovery and reuse program. The helicopter dropped the rocket a few seconds later.

title: NASA Announces Winners of 2022 Human Exploration Rover Challenge
summary: NASA has recognized a new generation of potential space explorers who competed in the agency’s 28th annual Human Exploration Rover Challenge.

title: South Korea’s Innospace schedules December test launch carrying Brazilian military payload
summary: South Korean rocket startup Innospace announced May 3 that it will conduct its first suborbital test launch of flight hardware in December from the Alcântara Space Center in Brazil, carrying a Brazilian military payload.

title: NASA's Mars Helicopter Scouts Ridgeline for Perseverance Science Team
summary: The rotorcraft provided rover scientists an aerial perspective of an interesting rocky outcrop.

title: NASA chief says cost-plus contracts are a “plague” on the space agency
summary: "You get it done with that competitive spirit. You get it done cheaper."

title: Rocket Lab catches a 1-ton booster falling back from space
summary: "It's kind of like Ghostbusters in some way."

title: CAPSTONE up next for Rocket Lab
summary: A NASA lunar cubesat mission is now scheduled to launch in late May on a Rocket Lab Electron after resolving issues with the rocket’s kick stage.

title: Rocket Lab catches Electron booster with a helicopter on first attempt
summary: In a significant achievement, public launch provider Rocket Lab has – with a few caveats – successfully used a helicopter to catch...

title: Space Force selects 125 industry proposals for on-orbit servicing technologies
summary: SpaceWERX selected 125 industry teams for the initial phase of the Orbital Prime program, an effort to develop technologies for orbital debris removal and other space services.
